description.zh-cn: 明朝第七位皇帝（1449年-1457年在位），明宣宗朱瞻基次子，明英宗朱祁镇异母弟。因土木堡之变中兄长被俘而即位，后在夺门之变中被复辟的兄长废黜。
description.en: The Jingtai Emperor (personal name Zhu Qiyu) was the seventh emperor of the Ming dynasty, reigning from 1449 to 1457. He was the second son of the Xuande Emperor and the younger half-brother of the Zhengtong Emperor. He ascended the throne after his brother was captured in the Tumu Crisis, and was later deposed by his brother in the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第六及第八位皇帝，景泰帝的异母兄长。
description.en: The Zhengtong and Tianshun Emperor (personal name Zhu Qizhen) was the sixth and eighth emperor of the Ming dynasty, and the elder half-brother of the Jingtai Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明朝与瓦剌的一场战役，明英宗在此战中被俘，直接导致朱祁钰被拥立为帝。
description.en: A military conflict between the Ming dynasty and the Oirats, in which Emperor Yingzong was captured, directly leading to Zhu Qiyu being enthroned.

description.zh-cn: 蒙古族的一支，在土木堡之变中俘虏了明英宗。
description.en: A group of Mongol tribes that captured Emperor Yingzong during the Tumu Crisis.

description.zh-cn: 瓦剌太师，在土木堡之变中俘虏了明英宗。
description.en: The Taishi of the Oirats who captured Emperor Yingzong during the Tumu Crisis.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗的皇后、明英宗的生母。在土木堡之变后，任命当时为郕王的朱祁钰为监国。
description.en: Empress of the Xuande Emperor and mother of Emperor Yingzong. After the Tumu Crisis, she appointed Zhu Qiyu, then Prince of Cheng, as regent.

description.zh-cn: 明朝名臣，在土木堡之变后拥立朱祁钰为帝，并领导了京师保卫战。
description.en: A famous official of the Ming dynasty who supported Zhu Qiyu's ascension to the throne after the Tumu Crisis and led the Defense of Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 于谦领导的明军成功抵御瓦剌进攻北京的战役。
description.en: A battle in which the Ming army, led by Yu Qian, successfully defended Beijing from the Oirat invasion.

description.zh-cn: 由曹吉祥、石亨、徐有贞等人发动，拥立太上皇明英宗复位的军事政变，导致景泰帝被废。
description.en: A military coup launched by Cao Jixiang, Shi Heng, Xu Youzhen, and others, which restored Emperor Yingzong to the throne and led to the deposition of the Jingtai Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明英宗长子，原为太子，被景泰帝废黜。后复位为太子并即位为帝，他恢复了叔叔景泰帝的帝号。
description.en: The eldest son of Emperor Yingzong. He was originally the crown prince but was deposed by the Jingtai Emperor. He was later reinstated as crown prince and ascended the throne, subsequently restoring his uncle's imperial title.

description.zh-cn: 明朝第五位皇帝，明英宗和景泰帝的父亲。
description.en: The fifth emperor of the Ming dynasty, father of Emperor Yingzong and the Jingtai Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 明宣宗的贤妃，景泰帝的生母。
description.en: A consort of the Xuande Emperor and the biological mother of the Jingtai Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝的原配皇后，因反对废黜太子朱见深而被废。
description.en: The first empress consort of the Jingtai Emperor, who was deposed for opposing the removal of Crown Prince Zhu Jianshen.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝的第二位皇后，太子朱见济的生母。
description.en: The second empress consort of the Jingtai Emperor and the biological mother of Crown Prince Zhu Jianji.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝的独子，被立为太子后次年夭折。
description.en: The only son of the Jingtai Emperor, who died prematurely the year after being made crown prince.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝与汪皇后所生的女儿。
description.en: Daughter of the Jingtai Emperor and Empress Wang.

description.zh-cn: 明朝宦官，夺门之变的主要策划者之一。
description.en: A Ming dynasty eunuch and one of the main orchestrators of the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 明朝将领，夺门之变的主要策划者之一。
description.en: A Ming dynasty general and one of the main orchestrators of the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 明朝官员，夺门之变的主要策划者之一。
description.en: A Ming dynasty official and one of the main orchestrators of the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 南明第一位皇帝，追尊景泰帝庙号为代宗。
description.en: The first emperor of the Southern Ming dynasty, who posthumously granted the Jingtai Emperor the temple name 'Daizong'.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝的皇贵妃，在景泰帝死后被明英宗下令殉葬。
description.en: Imperial Noble Consort of the Jingtai Emperor, who was ordered by Emperor Yingzong to be buried alive as a human sacrifice after the Jingtai Emperor's death.

description.zh-cn: 明朝大学士，成功劝谏明英宗赦免汪皇后的殉葬。
description.en: A Grand Secretary of the Ming dynasty who successfully persuaded Emperor Yingzong to spare Empress Wang from being sacrificed.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝朱祁钰是明英宗朱祁镇的同父异母弟。
description.en: The Jingtai Emperor Zhu Qiyu was the younger half-brother of the Emperor Yingzong Zhu Qizhen.

description.zh-cn: 土木之变中明英宗被俘，为朱祁钰（时为郕王）继位成为景泰帝提供了直接契机。
description.en: The capture of Emperor Yingzong during the Tumu Crisis provided the direct opportunity for Zhu Qiyu (then Prince of Cheng) to ascend the throne as the Jingtai Emperor.

description.zh-cn: 在土木之变中俘虏了明英宗。
description.en: Captured Emperor Yingzong during the Tumu Crisis.

description.zh-cn: 在明英宗被俘后，联合其他大臣拥立郕王朱祁钰为皇帝。
description.en: After Emperor Yingzong was captured, he, along with other ministers, supported the enthronement of the Prince of Cheng, Zhu Qiyu, as emperor.

description.zh-cn: 在明英宗被俘后，首先任命朱祁钰为监国，为其后登基铺平了道路。
description.en: After Emperor Yingzong was captured, she first appointed Zhu Qiyu as regent, paving the way for his subsequent enthronement.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝即位后，任命于谦为兵部尚书，领导京师保卫战。
description.en: After ascending the throne, the Jingtai Emperor appointed Yu Qian as the Minister of War to lead the Defense of Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 作为兵部尚书，领导了北京保卫战并取得胜利。
description.en: As Minister of War, he led the Defense of Beijing to victory.

description.zh-cn: 明军在北京保卫战中击退了瓦剌的进攻。
description.en: The Ming army repelled the Oirat invasion during the Defense of Beijing.

description.zh-cn: 朱祁钰将从瓦剌归来的兄长明英宗软禁，并废黜其子朱见深的太子之位，双方关系敌对。明英宗复辟后将朱祁钰废为郕王并上恶谥“戾”。
description.en: Zhu Qiyu placed his elder brother Emperor Yingzong under house arrest upon his return from Oirat captivity and deposed his son Zhu Jianshen as crown prince, creating a hostile relationship. After Emperor Yingzong was restored, he deposed Zhu Qiyu to Prince of Cheng and gave him the malicious posthumous name 'Li' (Adverse).

description.zh-cn: 废黜了时为太子的朱见深（后来的明宪宗），改立自己的儿子朱见济为太子。
description.en: Deposed the then Crown Prince Zhu Jianshen (later the Chenghua Emperor) and appointed his own son, Zhu Jianji, as the new crown prince.

description.zh-cn: 通过夺门之变，被软禁的太上皇明英宗成功复辟帝位。
description.en: Through the Duomen Coup, the Grand Emperor Emeritus Yingzong, who was under house arrest, successfully restored himself to the throne.

description.zh-cn: 夺门之变导致在位的景泰帝被废黜，并于当月去世。
description.en: The Duomen Coup led to the deposition of the reigning Jingtai Emperor, who died later that month.

description.zh-cn: 作为主要策划者之一，发动了夺门之变。
description.en: As one of the main orchestrators, he launched the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 作为主要策划者之一，发动了夺门之变。
description.en: As one of the main orchestrators, he launched the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 作为主要策划者之一，发动了夺门之变。
description.en: As one of the main orchestrators, he launched the Duomen Coup.

description.zh-cn: 即位后，恢复了叔叔景泰帝的皇帝尊号，并上谥号“恭仁康定景皇帝”。
description.en: After ascending the throne, he restored his uncle the Jingtai Emperor's imperial title and gave him the posthumous name 'Gongren Kangding Jing Huangdi'.

description.zh-cn: 南明弘光帝为景泰帝追上庙号“代宗”和更长的谥号。
description.en: The Hongguang Emperor of the Southern Ming posthumously honored the Jingtai Emperor with the temple name 'Daizong' and a longer posthumous title.

description.zh-cn: 景泰帝死后，明英宗下令唐皇贵妃为其殉葬。
description.en: After the Jingtai Emperor's death, Emperor Yingzong ordered Imperial Noble Consort Tang to be buried alive as a human sacrifice.

description.zh-cn: 成功劝谏明英宗，使被废的汪皇后免于为景泰帝殉葬。
description.en: Successfully persuaded Emperor Yingzong to spare the deposed Empress Wang from being sacrificed for the Jingtai Emperor.
